treatment.reference: Isolation and Characterization of Two New Methane-Producing Cocci: Methanogenium olentangyi, sp. nov., and Methanococcus deltae, sp. nov. Arch Microbiol 134:28-32
treatment.description: Irregular cocci, cell diameter 1.0-1.5 µm. Non-motile. Cell walls sensitive to 0.001% SDS and distilled water. Colonial morphology: Circular, shiny, greenish-yellow with dark centers, convex. DNA G + C content: 40.5 mol%. Growth temperature optimum: 37 ˚C, range 30- 45 ˚C. Physiology: Strict anaerobe, CO2 plus H2, and formate serve as substrates for growth and methane production. Phenol red not reduced. Nutrition: Obligate marine methanogen, requires 3 % NaCl for growth, optimum NaCl concentration is 3.5 - 4.0 %. Acetate, trypticase, yeast extract, vitamins not required for growth. Type strain: ARC. The description of the type strain is the same as for the species. Did not grow on methanol, methylamine, acetate, yeast extract, trypticase, and vitamins.
